Class Card

java.lang.Object
Card
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable
public class Card extends Object implements Comparable
Represents a playing card Has the fields suit and rank, implements Comparable for easy sorting For use in the Deck class
Author:
Rory McGuire

    • setRank

      public void setRank(String r)
      Sets the rank field to an integer equivalent to r If r is not one of the accepted rank values, rank is assigned the value 0
      Parameters:
      r - the value to be assigned to rank

    • setRank

      Parameters:
      r - the int value to be assigned to rank

    • setSuit

      public void setSuit(String s)
      Sets the suit field to the value of s If s is not an accepted value, the lowest ranking suit value is assigned to suit instead
      Parameters:
      s - the String value to be assigned to suit

    • setSuit

      public void setSuit(int s)
      Sets the suit to the String value associated with the int value s
      Parameters:
      s - int value that the corresponding String value will be assigned to suit
